subanswer.text: Jeff makes one trip from home to work (to cover 3 miles) and another reverse trip from work back to home every single day he goes to work; hence these constitute a pair or 'round trip'. Since both journeys together add up to doubled distance i.e., 3+3=6 miles per day, then over five days, this totals to an average walking length of 6*5=30 Miles Weekly. The answer is 30.

1.subquestion: In one trip (to or from work), how many miles does Jeff cover walking?

subanswer.text: Everyday, Jeff covers 6 miles going to work and returning home. Overworked five days, he will therefore walk 6 * 5 = 30 miles overall. The answer is 30.
